## Description {#details}

A node in the call graph for a module.

Typically represents a function in the call graph. There are also special &quot;null&quot; nodes used to represent theoretical entries in the call graph.

Definition at line 165 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h">CallGraph.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

### CalledFunctionsVector {#a4bdeedd19891bf099e456c984e873597}

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h/#l00180">180</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h">CallGraph.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### CallRecord {#afe3782c535fa39673c4e160fcbdf1515}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>using llvm::CallGraphNode::CallRecord =  std::pair&lt;std::optional&lt;WeakTrackingVH&gt;, CallGraphNode &#42;&gt;</>}>
A pair of the calling instruction (a call or invoke) and the call graph node being called.

Call graph node may have two types of call records which represent an edge in the call graph - reference or a call edge. Reference edges are not associated with any call instruction and are created with the first field set to <code>None</code>, while real call edges have instruction address in this field. Therefore, all real call edges are expected to have a value in the first field and it is not supposed to be <code>nullptr</code>. Reference edges, for example, are used for connecting broker function caller to the callback function for callback call sites.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h/#l00177">177</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h">CallGraph.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### const&#95;iterator {#a2efcd286336d8fc7014c5765f99a94af}

### removeAnyCallEdgeTo() {#ad2a5c5546a1d16403d77d2a437ab7dd6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CallGraphNode::removeAnyCallEdgeTo (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callgraphnode">CallGraphNode</a> &#42; Callee)</>}>
Removes all call edges from this node to the specified callee function.

This takes more time to execute than removeCallEdgeTo, so it should not be used unless necessary.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h/#l00264">264</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/callgraph-h">CallGraph.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/callgraph-cpp/#l00229">229</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/callgraph-cpp">CallGraph.cpp</a>.
